official-title.#text: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to establish the Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That

clause 1 of rule X of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by redesignating paragraphs (f) through (t) as paragraphs (g) through (u) and by inserting after paragraph (e) the following new paragraph:
Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs.
Modification or elimination of underperforming or nonessential Federal programs.
Identification of Federal programs and activities that duplicate or compete with activities available from the private sector.
Clause 4 of rule X of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

text.#text: The
research, review, and study Federal programs that are underperforming or nonessential; and
determine which Federal programs should be modified or eliminated;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for action designed to modify or eliminate underperforming or nonessential Federal programs; and

text.#text: develop recommendations to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

text.#text: a detailed statement of the findings and conclusions of the
a list of underperforming or nonessential Federal programs; and
at least once a year, reports including—
legislation to eliminate the programs described in section subdivision (ii) and rescissions based on the findings of the report described in subdivision (i).
submit to the
Clause 5(a) of rule X of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
Four members from the
Four members from the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

text.#text: Four members from the
Four members from the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and designated by the Speaker as the Chair of the Committee.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: One member who does not serve on any of the committees described in items (i) through (iv), who shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and designated by the Speaker as the Vice Chair of the Committee.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: One member who does not serve on any of the committees described in items (i) through (iv), who shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be composed of members as follows:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

text.#text: The

A member of the Committee may not serve on the committee during more than three Congresses in a period of five successive Congresses (disregarding for this purpose any service for less than a full session in a Congress).
The Chair and Vice Chair of the Committee shall not be from the same political party.
Rule X of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by adding at the end the following new clause:

rules-clause-header.#text: Expedited procedures for legislation reported by the Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

text.#text: With respect to any bill or resolution reported by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is not in session) that begins on the date the

reports the bill or resolution, it is in order to move to proceed to the consideration of the bill or resolution. The motion is highly privileged and is not debatable, an amendment to the motion is not in order, and it is not in order to move to reconsider the vote by which the motion is agreed to or disagreed to.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Committee on the Elimination of Nonessential Federal Programs

text.#text: After the expiration of the 7-day period (excluding any day on which the

Debate on the bill or resolution shall be limited to not more than 10 hours, which shall be divided equally between those favoring and those opposing the bill or resolution. A motion to further limit debate is not debatable.
An amendment to, or motion to recommit, the bill or resolution is not in order, and it is not in order to move to reconsider the vote by which the bill or resolution is agreed to or disagreed to.
